etymology.description: 土(土) (tǔ, 'earth') + 土(土) (tǔ, 'earth') + 土(土) (tǔ, 'earth') -> multiple layers of earth -> tall (of earth)
etymology.interpretation: The character 垚(yáo) uses a repetitive stacking of 土(土) (tǔ, 'earth') to represent height, emphasizing an abundance or surplus of earth by visually stacking it.

examples.chinese: 那座垚堆(那座垚堆)高耸入云(高聳入雲)，直达苍穹(直達蒼穹)。
examples.pinyin: nà zuò yáo duī gāo sǒng rù yún, zhí dá cāng qióng.
examples.english: That mound towers high, reaching into the vault of the skies.

examples.chinese: 村前的垚丘(村前的垚丘)稳固屹立(穩固屹立)，历经风霜(歷經風霜)。
examples.pinyin: cūn qián de yáo qiū wěn gù yì lì, lì jīng fēng shuāng.
examples.english: The mound in front of the village stands firmly, having endured the tests of time and weather.
